channel.title: Comments on: Progress on Python-Powered randomized quiz generator
channel.description: iteration, making, building, and coding in education

item.title: By: Evan Weinberg
item.dc:creator: Evan Weinberg
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2012/09/01/progress-on-python-powered-randomized-quiz-generator/#comment-113">Jim P</a>.
Hi Jim,
If you click on the 'play' button, you should see the questions pop up one by one. I've made some changes since the weekend based on some comments, new things I've learned to do, and suggestions from readers and students. Check out the questions and let me know what you think.
Thanks!
Evan
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jim P.

Hi Jim,

If you click on the ‘play’ button, you should see the questions pop up one by one. I’ve made some changes since the weekend based on some comments, new things I’ve learned to do, and suggestions from readers and students. Check out the questions and let me know what you think.

Thanks!

Evan

item.title: By: Jim P
item.dc:creator: Jim P
item.description:
awesome idea! I've tried doing something similar with excel, but it was far too restricting in terms of what I needed from it. I would love to learn how this works, but my programming ability is close to non-existent...
I tried going on this website to see if I can learn how to use what you wrote: http://repl.it/Chw but I didn't even understand what I could do on it!
If you could offer some instructions, I would love to be a beta tester!
Thanks!
item.content:encoded:
awesome idea! I’ve tried doing something similar with excel, but it was far too restricting in terms of what I needed from it. I would love to learn how this works, but my programming ability is close to non-existent…

I tried going on this website to see if I can learn how to use what you wrote:
http://repl.it/Chw
but I didn’t even understand what I could do on it!

If you could offer some instructions, I would love to be a beta tester!

Thanks!
